i1.name: The_Darkin_Scythe
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Kayn''' has a secondary {{tt|experience bar|Additional info in the notes below}} that tracks progress toward {{ci|Rhaast|Darkin}} and {{ci|Shadow Assassin}} forms. He gathers orbs from champion {{tip|takedown|takedowns}} and each instance of [[damage]] (excluding [[damage over time]]) against champions. Once he has earned enough orbs, he unlocks a form based on whether he earned more from {{tip|Melee}} or {{tip|Ranged}} champions (for {{ci|Rhaast|Darkin}} and {{ci|Shadow Assassin}}, respectively), with the other form unlocked later.

'''Kayn''' can return to the [[Spawn|summoning platform]] to transform over 6 seconds, during which he is {{tip|invulnerable}}, {{tip|untargetable}}, and unable to act. '''Kayn''' cannot choose a form if he is unable to cast abilities. The transformation will permanently empower some of '''Kayn's''' abilities, and he gains a one-time [[Homeguard]].

[[File:Shadow Assassin OriginalSquare.png|20px|border|link=]] {{sbc|Shadow Assassin Bonus:}} If '''Kayn''' has been [[combat status|out of combat]] with enemy champions for over 8 seconds, or he casts {{ai|Umbral Trespass|Kayn}}, he deals {{pp|key=%|8 to 30}} of {{tt|post-mitigation damage|Damage calculated after modifiers}} dealt against enemy champions as {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}, lasting for 3 seconds upon entering combat and also applying on the first instance of damage dealt. If this effect is ready, it will not go on cooldown by receiving damage.

[[File:Rhaast OriginalSquare.png|20px|border|link=]] {{sbc|Darkin Bonus:}} '''Rhaast''' {{tip|heals}} for {{pp|key=%|25 to 35}} of the {{tt|post-mitigation|Damage calculated after modifiers}} {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} that he deals to enemy champions with his [[champion ability|abilities]].
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Kayn has a secondary experience bar that tracks progress toward Darkin and Shadow Assassin forms. He gathers orbs from champion takedowns and each instance of damage (excluding damage over time) against champions. Once he has earned enough orbs, he unlocks a form based on whether he earned more from Melee or Ranged champions (for Darkin and Shadow Assassin, respectively), with the other form unlocked later.
Kayn can return to the Spawn to transform over 6 seconds, during which he is invulnerable, untargetable, and unable to act. Kayn cannot choose a form if he is unable to cast abilities. The transformation will permanently empower some of Kayn's abilities, and he gains a one-time Homeguard.
File:Shadow Assassin OriginalSquare.png Shadow Assassin Bonus: If Kayn has been combat status with enemy champions for over 8 seconds, or he casts Kayn's Umbral Trespass, he deals 8% − 30% (based on level) of post-mitigation damage dealt against enemy champions as bonus magic damage, lasting for 3 seconds upon entering combat and also applying on the first instance of damage dealt. If this effect is ready, it will not go on cooldown by receiving damage.
File:Rhaast OriginalSquare.png Darkin Bonus: Rhaast heals for 25% − 35% (based on level) of the post-mitigation physical damage that he deals to enemy champions with his champion ability.
i1.notes:
* Entering transformation will not {{tip|Homing projectile destruction|destroy}} in-flight {{tip|projectile|projectiles}}. ; The Orb System The experience is depicted as orbs that drop upon the ground. {{tip|Melee}} champions drop red orbs that grant progress towards {{ci|Rhaast|Darkin}}, while {{tip|ranged}} champions drop blue orbs that grant progress for {{ci|Shadow Assassin}}. Orbs will remain on the ground until automatically collected by '''Kayn''' regardless of range once he leaves [[combat status|combat]]. The orbs will be collected even if '''Kayn''' {{tip|death|dies}}. The experience bar above his portrait gauges his current progression, the color reflects the form with greater progress. '''Kayn''' can transform by interacting with his portrait, and can wait 4 minutes until the other form becomes available, reduced by 5 seconds for each collected orb of their type after that. * ''Melee'' orbs grant 2 points per hit and 6 points per takedown. * ''Ranged'' orbs grant 3 points per hit and 7 points per takedown. * The amount of points received per orb is multiplied by {{pp|type=minutes|3;3+(10-3)/8*(x-1) for 6; then + (10-3)/8*x*1.15|0;5 to 13 by 1|formula=Increases each second after 5 minutes. At 10 minutes it increases by 15% more per second until it caps at 13 minutes.}}. * The bar gets filled up completely at 500 points. * If the two forms are within 8% of each other, the last champion range type hit will determine the winner. If both types are hit at the same time, the trasformation will default to {{ci|Rhaast|Darkin}}. * Each side's bar has a bucket system, starting at 60 points. ** Each time an orb is taken the system checks if there's an amount of points in the bucket equal to or higher than the amount received from the orb.
If there is, '''Kayn''' is given an additional orb of the same type he received, while also subtracting that amount of points from the bucket. ** The bucket fills by {{fd|0.8}} points per second if out of champion combat for 70 seconds.

q1.name: Reaping_Slash
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Kayn''' {{tip|dashes}} in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to enemies he passes through. He then swings his scythe, dealing the same damage to surrounding enemies.
Both instances of ''Reaping Slash'' deal 40 '''bonus''' damage against {{tip|minion|minions}} and {{tip|monster|monsters}}.

[[File:Rhaast OriginalSquare.png|20px|border|link=]] {{sbc|Darkin Bonus:}} ''Reaping Slash's'' damage is modified to deal {{as|65% AD}} {{as|(+ 5% {{as|(+ 5% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of the target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|physical damage}} for both instances. This damage has a cap against monsters that does not include the '''bonus''' damage.
''Reaping Slash's'' dash speed scales with '''Kayn's''' {{sti|ms|{{as|'''total''' movement speed}}}}.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Kayn dashes in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies he passes through. He then swings his scythe, dealing the same damage to surrounding enemies.
Both instances of Reaping Slash deal 40 bonus damage against minions and monsters.
File:Rhaast OriginalSquare.png Darkin Bonus: Reaping Slash's damage is modified to deal 65% AD (+ 5% (+ 5% per 100 bonus AD) of the target's maximum health) physical damage for both instances. This damage has a cap against monsters that does not include the bonus damage.
Reaping Slash's dash speed scales with Kayn's total movement speed.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|75 to 155}} {{as|(+ 65% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Total Damage|{{ap|75*2 to 155*2}} {{as|(+ 130% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}
{{st|Non-Champion Damage|{{ap|75+40 to 155+40}} {{as|(+ 65% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Total Non-Champion Damage|{{ap|(75+40)*2 to (155+40)*2}} {{as|(+ 130% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}
{{st|Capped Monster Damage per Hit|{{ap|200 to 400}}|Total Capped Monster Damage|{{ap|200*2 to 400*2}}}}
q1.notes:
* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} will block only a single instance of damage - either the dash or the slash.
* If the {{tip|dash}} is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}, '''Kayn''' will not swing his scythe.
* ''Reaping Slash's '' swing can be performed quicker if the dash stops prematurely upon colliding with terrain.
* As the {{ci|Shadow Assassin}}, an alternate icon for {{ai|Reaping Slash A|Kayn|Reaping Slash}} is used but has no modified effect.
* Other abilities can be queued while casting ''Reaping Slash''.
* All [[active ability items|item actives]] can be used during ''Reaping Slash''.
** {{ii|Stopwatch}} and {{ii|Zhonya's Hourglass}} will not stop the dash or the damage from occurring.
** Using an item active that has a dash (e.g. {{ii|Hextech Rocketbelt}}, {{ii|Galeforce}}) will override ''Reaping Slash's'' dash if used before it ends, preventing the slash from happening. If used after ''Reaping Slash's'' dash ends, '''Kayn''' can reposition where the slash happens.

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ 65% bonus AD)
  • Total Damage: (+ 130% bonus AD)

• Non-Champion Damage: (+ 65% bonus AD)
  • Total Non-Champion Damage: (+ 130% bonus AD)

• Capped Monster Damage per Hit:
  • Total Capped Monster Damage:

w1.name: Blade's_Reach
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Kayn''' swings his scythe in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow|slowing}} enemies hit by 90% decaying over {{fd|1.5}} seconds.

[[File:Shadow Assassin OriginalSquare.png|20px|border|link=]] {{sbc|Shadow Assassin Bonus:}} ''Blade's Reach's'' area is extended by 200 units. '''Kayn''' conjures an {{tip|untargetable}} ''living shadow'' at the casting position to perform ''Blade's Reach's'' sweep over {{fd|0.55}} seconds in his stead, removing the ability's cast time.
[[File:Rhaast OriginalSquare.png|20px|border|link=]] {{sbc|Darkin Bonus:}} ''Blade's Reach''{{tip|airborne|knocks up}} enemies hit for 1 second.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Kayn swings his scythe in the target direction, dealing physical damage and slowing enemies hit by 90% decaying over 1.5 seconds.
File:Shadow Assassin OriginalSquare.png Shadow Assassin Bonus: Blade's Reach's area is extended by 200 units. Kayn conjures an untargetable living shadow at the casting position to perform Blade's Reach's sweep over 0.55 seconds in his stead, removing the ability's cast time.
File:Rhaast OriginalSquare.png Darkin Bonus: Blade's Reachknocks up enemies hit for 1 second.

e1.name: Shadow_Step
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Kayn''' gains {{sti|ms|{{as|40% '''bonus total''' movement speed}}}}, {{tip|ghosting}} and the ability to ignore terrain collision for a duration. If he has been [[combat status|in combat]] with enemy champions within the last 3 seconds, ''Shadow Step'' will instead last {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
'''Kayn''' {{tip|heals}} himself upon entering terrain for the first time from casting ''Shadow Step'' and he gains {{tip|unobstructed vision}} while inside.

Receiving damage from or dealing damage to an enemy {{tip|champion}} while ''Shadow Step'' is active reduces its remaining duration to {{fd|1.5}} seconds. This effect also cannot remain active out of terrain for longer than {{fd|1.5}} seconds and will cancel immediately if '''Kayn''' performs a [[basic attack]] or becomes {{tip|immobilize|immobilized}}, excluding from {{tip|sleep}}{{bug}}, or {{tip|polymorph|polymorphed}}.

[[File:Shadow Assassin OriginalSquare.png|20px|border|link=]] {{sbc|Shadow Assassin Bonus:}} ''Shadow Step's'' {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced to 8 seconds at all ranks. '''Kayn''' gains 100% {{tip|slow resist}} and, upon entering terrain, the {{as|'''bonus total''' movement speed}} is increased to {{as|80%|ms}} for the remaining duration.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Kayn gains 40% bonus total movement speed, ghosting and the ability to ignore terrain collision for a duration. If he has been combat status with enemy champions within the last 3 seconds, Shadow Step will instead last 1.5 seconds.
Kayn heals himself upon entering terrain for the first time from casting Shadow Step and he gains unobstructed vision while inside.
Receiving damage from or dealing damage to an enemy champion while Shadow Step is active reduces its remaining duration to 1.5 seconds. This effect also cannot remain active out of terrain for longer than 1.5 seconds and will cancel immediately if Kayn performs a basic attack or becomes immobilized, excluding from sleepUnknown value: bug, or polymorphed.
File:Shadow Assassin OriginalSquare.png Shadow Assassin Bonus: Shadow Step's cooldown is reduced to 8 seconds at all ranks. Kayn gains 100% slow resist and, upon entering terrain, the bonus total movement speed is increased to 80% for the remaining duration.
e1.notes:
* As {{ci|Rhaast}}, an alternate icon for {{ai|Shadow Step R|Kayn|Shadow Step}} is used but has no modified effect.
* The {{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}} {{tip|stacks multiplicatively}} with other sources of movement speed boosts.
* Self {{tip|immobilize|immobilizations}} such as {{ii|Stopwatch}} / {{ii|Zhonya's Hourglass}} also count for interrupting ''Shadow Step''.
* {{si|Recall}} is disabled while '''Kayn''' is inside terrain.
* Enemies cannot see '''Kayn''' while he is inside of terrain unless they have terrain-piercing vision, such as {{ai|Heightened Senses|Quinn}}, {{ai|Hawkshot|Ashe}} or {{tip|unobstructed vision}}.
** However, enemies and allies (including '''Kayn''') will be notified when nearby terrain is infested if '''Kayn''' is within 1000 units of an enemy champion - with an indicator being placed on the terrain with a direct line between '''Kayn''' and the enemy champion. ''Slightly less than standard sight radius, but more than the {{tip|camouflage}} detection radius.''
* '''Kayn''' can move up to 550 units beyond the outer-edge of the battlefield.
* ''Shadow Step'' can interact with [[Terrain#Player-Generated|player-generated terrain]].
* If '''Kayn''' is inside terrain when the effect ends, he will be placed correspondingly to the nearest valid space.
* {{tip|Sleep}} will not interrupt ''Shadow Step''.{{bug}}

r1.name: Umbral_Trespass
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Kayn''' ''marks'' enemy champions he damaged in the last {{fd|3.15}} seconds.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Kayn''' {{tip|vanish|vanishes}} and {{tip|dash|dashes}} to a ''marked'' enemy champion. Upon arrival, he {{tip|channel|channels}} for up to {{fd|2.5}} seconds, {{tip|attach|attaching}} to the target and {{tip|true sight|revealing}} them. ''Umbral Trespass'' can be recast after {{fd|0.75}} seconds during the channel, and does so automatically after the duration or is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}.

{{sbc|Recast:}} After a {{fd|0.75}}-second delay, '''Kayn''' deals {{as|physical damage}} to the target and {{tip|dash|dashes}} out from their body in the target direction while still being {{tip|untargetable}}.

[[File:Shadow Assassin OriginalSquare.png|20px|border|link=]] {{sbc|Shadow Assassin Bonus:}} ''Umbral Trespass'' gains 200 '''bonus''' cast range and emerge range. Additionally, emerging will reset {{ai|The Darkin Scythe A|Kayn|The Darkin Scythe's}} {{sti|cooldown}}.

[[File:Rhaast OriginalSquare.png|20px|border|link=]] {{sbc|Darkin Bonus:}} ''Umbral Trespass'' is modified to deal {{as|15% {{as|(+ 13% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of the target's '''maximum''' health}} {{as|physical damage}}, and {{tip|heals}} him for {{as|{{fd|9.75}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|8.45}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}}.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Kayn marks enemy champions he damaged in the last 3.15 seconds.
Active: Kayn vanishes and dashes to a marked enemy champion. Upon arrival, he channels for up to 2.5 seconds, attaching to the target and revealing them. Umbral Trespass can be recast after 0.75 seconds during the channel, and does so automatically after the duration or is interrupted.
Recast: After a 0.75-second delay, Kayn deals physical damage to the target and dashes out from their body in the target direction while still being untargetable.
File:Shadow Assassin OriginalSquare.png Shadow Assassin Bonus: Umbral Trespass gains 200 bonus cast range and emerge range. Additionally, emerging will reset Kayn's The Darkin Scythe's cooldown.
File:Rhaast OriginalSquare.png Darkin Bonus: Umbral Trespass is modified to deal 15% (+ 13% per 100 bonus AD) of the target's maximum health physical damage, and heals him for 9.75% (+ 8.45% per 100 bonus AD) of target's maximum health.
r1.notes:
*The initial cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}}.
**Detonating the ability manually does not.
**The ability activation happens when '''Kayn''' is attached to his target and the channel starts.
***{{ci|Kassadin}} cannot gain a stack for {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}} because '''Kayn''' is untargetable during the activation.
* The ability will recast if '''Kayn''' is ordered a movement command.
* The amount of time it takes for '''Kayn''' to {{tip|attach}} to his target is between {{fd|0.5}} seconds (cast from max range, not as {{ci|Shadow Assassin}}) and {{fd|0.25}} seconds (cast from point blank range).
** This duration is fixed, meaning '''Kayn''' will attach regardless of how far away the target gets while he is {{tip|dash|dashing}} toward them.
* If the target {{tip|death|dies}}, enters {{tip|resurrection}}, or is sent to the {{ai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}} while '''Kayn''' is {{tip|attached}}, he will instantly detach and reappear on top of the target's location. This does not occur if '''Kayn''' is in the process of emerging from the target.
** If those same conditions occur before the attachment, '''Kayn''' will reappear at the target's location after completing the dash.
*** In both of these cases, ''Umbral Trespass'' will occasionally not go on cooldown.{{bug}}
** '''Kayn''' will automatically emerge when attached to a {{tip|clone}} that expires.
* If '''Kayn''' dies while {{tip|attached}} and the recast is available, ''Umbral Trespass' '' damage is dealt immediately. If the recast is not available, ''Umbral Trespass' '' damage is not dealt at all.
** Entering {{tip|resurrection}} while {{tip|attached}} does not deal ''Umbral Trespass' '' damage regardless of if the recast is available or not.
*** '''Kayn''' will detach immediately in both cases.
* During ''Umbral Trespass'', '''Kayn''' will not take the self-inflicted damage from {{iis|Death's Dance}} {{nie|Ignore Pain}}.
* As {{ci|Rhaast}}, ''Umbral Trespass'' will not {{tip|heal}} if the target dies during the {{fd|0.75}}-second delay before emerging.
* ''Umbral Trespass' '' interactions with {{tip|crowd control}}:
** Being {{tip|stun|stunned}} or {{tip|silence|silenced}} or falling {{tip|asleep}} while {{tip|attach|attached}} will cause the ability to recast automatically (even during the {{fd|0.75}}-second delay before '''Kayn''' is able to recast after attaching).
** ''Umbral Trespass'' {{tip|cleanse|cleanses}} '''Kayn''' from {{tip|drowsy|drowsiness}}.
** '''Kayn''' is immune to {{tip|flee|fear}} during ''Umbral Trespass''.
** {{tip|Root|Roots}} will not prevent '''Kayn''' from initiating the recast.
** {{tip|Airborne|Displacements}} cannot interrupt the initial dash and neither can they apply while '''Kayn''' is attached. If the ''airborne'' source applies a {{tip|debuff}}, '''Kayn''' attaches to his target immediately, ending the dash prematurely in the process. The debuff is also removed instantly.
* Until the recast or after the duration, the ability will have had no effect on the target for the purposes of {{ri|Electrocute}} or the 'in-combat' status.
* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} will prevent '''Kayn''' from infesting the target, but will do nothing to mitigate the recast when used once he has already infested them.
** If '''Kayn''' targets an enemy that is currently being protected by a ''spell shield'', the ability will simply go on cooldown without making him infest his target.
*** This is also true for {{cai|Riposte|Fiora}}.
* ''Umbral Trespass'' cannot be cast on targetable {{tip|zombie state|zombie states}} such as {{ci|Sion}} during {{ai|Glory in Death|Sion}}.
* The damage is '''not''' blocked if the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}.
* '''Kayn''' will copy his target's total [[size]] for ''Umbral Trespass' '' duration, even if their size is smaller than his.
* The screen will direct to the target's position upon attaching.
* As {{ci|Rhaast}}, an alternate icon is used for the initial activation of {{ai|Umbral Trespass R|Kayn|Umbral Trespass}}.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Kayn''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}} and dashing out of the victim:
** The dash out is not interrupted by {{tip|cast-inhibiting crowd control}}.
{{ct|attack=false|move=false|cast=false|items=false|consume=false|spells=true,false,false,false,interrupts|interrupts=death,silence}}
